summary.long: 1 Corinthians is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: Paul, called to be an apostle of Jesus Christ through the will of God, and Sosthenes, our brother,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To the church of God which is at Corinth, to those who are sanctified in Christ Jesus, called to be saints, with all who in every place call on the name of Jesus Christ our Lord, both their Lord and ours:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I thank my God always on your behalf for the grace of God which has been given to you through Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By Him you are enriched in everything, in all speech and in all knowledge,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: even as the testimony of Christ was confirmed in you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that you are not lacking in any gift while waiting for the revelation of our Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will strengthen you to the end, so that you may be blameless on the day of our Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God is faithful, and by Him you were called to the fellowship of His Son, Jesus Christ our Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now I ask you, brothers, by the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, that you all speak in agreement and that there be no divisions among you. But be perfectly joined together in the same mind and in the same judgment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it has been declared to me concerning you, my brothers, by those who are of the house of Chloe, that there are contentions among you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now this is what I mean: Every one of you is saying, “I am of Paul,” or “I am of Apollos,” or “I am of Cephas,” or “I am of Christ.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is Christ divided? Was Paul crucified for you? Or were you baptized in the name of Paul?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I thank God that I baptized none of you except Crispus and Gaius,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: lest any should say that I had baptized in my own name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I also baptized the household of Stephanas. Besides them, I do not know whether I baptized any other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Christ did not send me to baptize, but to preach the gospel, not with eloquent words, lest the cross of Christ should be made of no effect.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For to those who are perishing, the preaching of the cross is foolishness, but to us who are being saved it is the power of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For it is written:
“I will destroy the wisdom of the wise,
    and will bring to nothing the understanding of the prudent.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Where is the wise? Where is the scribe? Where is the debater of this age? Has God not made the wisdom of this world foolish?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For since, in the wisdom of God, the world through its wisdom did not know God, it pleased God through the foolishness of preaching to save those who believe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Jews require a sign, and the Greeks seek after wisdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But we preach Christ crucified, a stumbling block to the Jews and foolishness to the Greeks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But to those who are called, both Jews and Greeks, we preach Christ as the power of God and the wisdom of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the foolishness of God is wiser than men, and the weakness of God is stronger than men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For observe your calling, brothers. Among you, not many wise men according to the flesh, not many mighty men, and not many noble men were called.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But God has chosen the foolish things of the world to confound the wise. God has chosen the weak things of the world to confound the things which are mighty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God has chosen the base things of the world and things which are despised. Yes, and He chose things which did not exist to bring to nothing things that do,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that no flesh should boast in His presence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But because of Him you are in Christ Jesus, whom God made unto us wisdom, righteousness, sanctification, and redemption.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, as it is written, “Let him who boasts, boast in the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Brothers, when I came to you, I did not come with superiority of speech or wisdom, declaring to you the testimony of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I determined not to know anything among you except Jesus Christ and Him crucified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I was with you in weakness and in fear and in much trembling.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My speech and my preaching was not with enticing words of man’s wisdom, but in demonstration of the Spirit and of power,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that your faith should not stand in the wisdom of men, but in the power of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet we speak wisdom among those who are mature, although not the wisdom of this age, nor of the rulers of this age, who are coming to nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But we speak the wisdom of God in a mystery, the hidden wisdom, which God ordained before the ages for our glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: None of the rulers of this age knew it. For had they known it, they would not have crucified the Lord of glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But as it is written,
“Eye has not seen,
    nor ear heard,
nor has it entered into the heart of man
    the things which God has prepared for those who love Him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But God has revealed them to us by His Spirit.
For the Spirit searches all things, yes, the deep things of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For what man knows the things of a man, except the spirit of man which is in him? Likewise, no one knows the things of God, except the Spirit of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now we have received not the spirit of the world, but the Spirit which is of God, so that we might know the things that are freely given to us by God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These things also we proclaim, not in the words which man’s wisdom teaches, but which the Holy Spirit teaches, comparing spiritual things with spiritual.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the natural man does not receive the things of the Spirit of God, for they are foolishness to him; nor can he know them, because they are spiritually discerned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he who is spiritual judges all things. Yet he himself is not judged by anyone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For
“who has known the mind of the Lord
    that he may instruct Him?”
But we have the mind of Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Brothers, I could not speak to you as to spiritual men, but as to worldly, even as to babes in Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have fed you with milk and not with solid food. For to this day you were not able to endure it. Nor are you able now,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for you are still worldly. Since there is envy, strife, and divisions among you, are you not worldly and behaving as mere men?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For while one says, “I am of Paul,” and another, “I am of Apollos,” are you not worldly?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who then is Paul, and who is Apollos, but ministers by whom you believed, even as the Lord gave to each one?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have planted, Apollos watered, but God gave the increase.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So then neither is he who plants nor he who waters anything, but God who gives the increase.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now he who plants and he who waters are one, and each one will receive his own reward according to his own labor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we are laborers together with God: You are God’s vineyard; you are God’s building.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: According to the grace of God which has been given to me, as a wise master builder, I have laid the foundation, but another builds on it. Now let each one take heed how he builds on it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For no one can lay another foundation than that which was laid, which is Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now if anyone builds on this foundation with gold, silver, precious stones, wood, hay, or stubble,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: each one’s work will be revealed. For the Day will declare it, because it will be revealed by fire, and the fire will test what sort of work each has done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone’s work which he has built on the foundation endures, he will receive a reward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone’s work is burned, he will suffer loss. But he himself will be saved, still going through the fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do you not know that you are the temple of God, and that the Spirit of God dwells in you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone defiles the temple of God, God will destroy him. For the temple of God is holy. And you are His temple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let no one deceive himself. If anyone among you seems to be wise in this world, let him become a fool that he may be wise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the wisdom of this world is foolishness with God. For it is written, “He catches the wise in their own craftiness,”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and again, “The Lord knows the thoughts of the wise, that they are vain.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore let no one boast in men. For all things are yours:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: whether Paul or Apollos or Cephas or the world or life or death or things present or things to come, all are yours,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and you are Christ’s, and Christ is God’s.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let a man so regard us as the ministers of Christ and stewards of the mysteries of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover it is required in stewards that a man be found faithful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But with me it is a very small thing that I should be judged by you or by man’s judgment. I do not even judge myself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I know nothing against myself. Yet I am not justified by this. But He who judges me is the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore judge nothing before the appointed time until the Lord comes. He will bring to light the hidden things of darkness and will reveal the purposes of the hearts. Then everyone will have commendation from God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Brothers, I have figuratively applied these things to myself and to Apollos for your sakes, so that you may learn from us not to think of men above that which is written, and that not one of you would be arrogant for one against another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For who makes you differ from another? And what do you have that you did not receive? Now if you received it, why do you boast as if you had not received it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now you are full, now you are rich; you have begun reigning as kings without us, and I wish to God you reigned, so that we also might reign with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I think that God has exhibited us, the apostles, last, as if we were sentenced to death. For we have been made a spectacle to the world, to angels and to men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We are fools for Christ’s sake, but you are wise in Christ. We are weak, but you are strong. You are honorable, but we are despised.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even to this present hour we both hunger and thirst, and are poorly clothed and beaten and homeless.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We labor, working with our own hands. Being reviled, we bless. Being persecuted, we endure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Being slandered, we encourage. We are made as the filth of the world, and are the refuse of all things to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I do not write these things to shame you, but as my beloved sons I warn you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if you were to have ten thousand instructors in Christ, yet you do not have many fathers. In Christ Jesus I have become a father to you through the gospel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I implore you, be followers of me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore I have sent Timothy to you. He is my beloved son and is faithful in the Lord. He will remind you of my ways which are in Christ, as I teach everywhere in every church.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now some are arrogant, as though I were not coming to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I will come to you shortly if the Lord wills. And I will know not only what those who are arrogant are saying, but also their power.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the kingdom of God is not in word, but in power.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What do you desire? Shall I come to you with a rod, or in love and in the spirit of meekness?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is actually reported that there is sexual immorality among you, and such immorality as is not even named among the Gentiles, that a man has his father’s wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you are arrogant. Instead you should have mourned, so that he who has done this deed might be removed from among you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For indeed, though absent in body but present in spirit, I have already, as if I were present, judged him who has done this deed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ. When you are assembled, along with my spirit, in the power of our Lord Jesus Christ,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: deliver him to Satan for the destruction of the flesh, so that the spirit may be saved on the day of the Lord Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your boasting is not good. Do you not know that a little yeast leavens the whole batch?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore purge out the old yeast, that you may be a new batch, since you are unleavened. For even Christ, our Passover, has been sacrificed for us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore let us keep the feast, not with old yeast, nor with the yeast of malice and wickedness, but with the unleavened bread of sincerity and truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I wrote to you in my letter not to keep company with sexually immoral people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet I did not mean the sexually immoral people of this world, or the covetous and extortioners, or the idolaters, since you would then need to go out of the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I have written to you not to keep company with any man who is called a brother, who is sexually immoral, or covetous, or an idolater, or a reviler, or a drunkard, or an extortioner. Do not even eat with such a person.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For what have I to do with judging those also who are outside? Do you not judge those who are inside?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But God judges those who are outside. Therefore “put away from among yourselves that wicked person.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Dare any of you, having a matter against another, go to the law before the unrighteous, and not before the saints?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do you not know that the saints will judge the world? If the world will be judged by you, are you unworthy to judge the smallest matters?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do you not know that we shall judge angels? How much more the things that pertain to this life?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If then you have judgments dealing with matters of this life, do you appoint as judges those who are least esteemed in the church?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I speak to your shame. Is it true that there is not even one wise man among you who shall be able to judge between his brothers?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But brother goes to the law against brother, and before unbelievers, at that.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore it is already an utter failure for you that you go to law against one another. Why not rather be wronged? Why not rather be defrauded?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you yourselves do wrong and defraud, and do this to your brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do you not know that the unrighteous will not inherit the kingdom of God? Do not be deceived. Neither the sexually immoral, nor idolaters, nor adulterers, nor male prostitutes, nor homosexuals,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: nor thieves, nor covetous, nor drunkards, nor revilers, nor extortioners will inherit the kingdom of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Such were some of you. But you were washed, you were sanctified, and you were justified in the name of the Lord Jesus by the Spirit of our God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “All things are lawful to me,” but not all things are helpful. “All things are lawful for me,” but I will not be brought under the power of anything.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Food is for the belly, and the belly is for food,” but God will destroy both of them. Now the body is not for sexual immorality, but for the Lord, and the Lord is for the body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God has raised up the Lord and will also raise us up by His own power.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do you not know that your bodies are the parts of Christ? Shall I then take the parts of Christ and make them the parts of a harlot? God forbid!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What? Do you not know that he who is joined to a harlot is one body with her? For “the two,” He says, “shall become one flesh.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he who is joined to the Lord becomes one spirit with Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Escape from sexual immorality. Every sin that a man commits is outside the body. But he who commits sexual immorality sins against his own body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What? Do you not know that your body is the temple of the Holy Spirit, who is in you, whom you have received from God, and that you are not your own?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You were bought with a price. Therefore glorify God in your body and in your spirit, which are God’s.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now concerning the things about which you wrote to me: “It is good for a man not to touch a woman.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless, because of sexual immorality, let every man have his own wife, and let every woman have her own husband.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let the husband render to the wife due affection, and likewise the wife to the husband.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The wife does not have authority over her own body, but the husband does. Likewise, the husband does not have authority over his own body, but the wife does.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not deprive one another except with consent for a time, that you may give yourselves to fasting and prayer. Then come together again, so that Satan does not tempt you for lack of self-control.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I speak this as a concession and not as a command.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I would that all men were even as I myself. But every man has his proper gift from God, one after this manner and another after that.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I say to the unmarried and widows that it is good for them if they live even as I am.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if they cannot restrain themselves, let them marry. For it is better to marry than to burn with passion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now to the married I command, not I, but the Lord, do not let the wife depart from her husband.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if she departs, let her remain unmarried or be reconciled to her husband. And do not let the husband divorce his wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To the rest I speak, not the Lord: If any brother has an unbelieving wife who consents to live with him, he should not divorce her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if the woman has an unbelieving husband who consents to live with her, she should not divorce him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the unbelieving husband is sanctified by the wife, and the unbelieving wife is sanctified by the husband. Otherwise, your children would be unclean. But now they are holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if the unbeliever departs, let that one depart. A brother or a sister is not bound in such cases. God has called us to peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For how do you know, O wife, whether you will save your husband? Or how do you know, O husband, whether you will save your wife?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as God has given to every man and as the Lord has called every man, so let him walk. This I command in all churches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is any man called while circumcised? Let him not become uncircumcised. Is any man called while uncircumcised? Let him not be circumcised.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Circumcision is nothing, and uncircumcision is nothing, but the keeping of the commandments of God is everything.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let each man remain in the same condition in which he was called.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Were you called while a servant? Do not worry about it. But if you may become free, do so.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he who is called in the Lord while a servant is the Lord’s freeman. Likewise, he who is called while free is Christ’s servant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You were bought at a price. Do not be the servants of men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Brothers, let every man, in whatever condition he is called, remain there with God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now concerning virgins, I have no command from the Lord. Yet I will give my judgment as one who has obtained mercy from the Lord to be faithful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I suppose therefore that this is good because of the present distress, that it is good for a man to remain as he is.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Are you committed to a wife? Do not seek to be uncommitted. Are you free from a wife? Do not seek a wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you marry, you have not sinned. And if a virgin marries, she has not sinned. Nevertheless they will have trouble in this life, but I would spare you that.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But this I say, brothers, the time is short. It remains that those who have wives should be as though they had none;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: those who weep, as though they did not weep; those who rejoice, as though they did not rejoice; those who buy, as though they possessed nothing;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and those who use this world, as though they did not make full use of it. For the form of this world is passing away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I prefer that you have no concern. He who is unmarried cares for the things of the Lord, how he may please the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he who is married cares for the things of the world, how he may please his wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is a difference between a wife and a virgin. The unmarried woman cares for the things of the Lord, that she may be holy in body and in spirit. But she who is married cares for the things of the world, how she may please her husband.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I say this for your own benefit, not to put any restraint upon you, but for what is proper, and that you may serve the Lord without distraction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If any man thinks that he is behaving improperly toward his virgin, and if she is past the flower of her youth, and passions so require, let him do what he will. He does not sin. Let them marry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless he who stands steadfast in his heart without necessity, and has power over his own will, and has so decreed in his heart that he will keep his virgin, does well.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So then he who gives her in marriage does well, but he who gives her not in marriage does better.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The wife is bound by the law as long as her husband lives. But if her husband dies, she is at liberty to be married to whom she will, but only in the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But in my judgment she is happier if she so remains as she is. And I think that I have the Spirit of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now as concerning food offered to idols: We know that “we all have knowledge.” Knowledge produces arrogance, but love edifies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So if anyone thinks that he knows anything, he knows nothing yet as he ought to know.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if anyone loves God, this one is known by Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So concerning the eating of foods that are offered in sacrifice to idols, we know that an idol is nothing in the world, and that there is no other God but one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For there are those who are called gods, whether in heaven or in earth, as there are many gods and many lords.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But for us there is but one God, the Father, from whom are all things and for whom we exist. And there is one Lord Jesus Christ, through whom are all things and through whom we exist.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, not everyone has this knowledge. Some, being accustomed to the idol until now, eat the food as a thing offered to an idol. So their weak conscience is defiled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But food does not commend us to God. Neither if we eat are we the better, nor if we do not eat are we the worse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But take heed, lest by any means this liberty of yours becomes a stumbling block to those who are weak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if anyone sees you, who have knowledge, eating in the idol’s temple, shall the conscience of him who is weak not be emboldened to eat those things which are offered to idols,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and by your knowledge shall the weak brother perish, for whom Christ died?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you thus sin against the brothers, wounding their weak conscience, you sin against Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, if food causes my brother to stumble, I will never eat meat, lest I cause my brother to stumble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Am I not an apostle? Am I not free? Have I not seen Jesus Christ our Lord? Are you not my work in the Lord?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I am not an apostle to others, yet indeed I am to you. For you are the seal of my apostleship in the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is my answer to those who examine me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do we have no right to eat and to drink?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do we not have the right to take along a believing wife as do other apostles, the brothers of the Lord, and Cephas?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or is it only Barnabas and I who have no right to refrain from working?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who goes to war at any time at his own expense? Who plants a vineyard, but does not eat of its fruit? Or who feeds a flock, but does not drink of the flock’s milk?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do I say these things as a man? Or does the law not say the same thing also?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it is written in the Law of Moses, “You shall not muzzle the mouth of the ox while it treads out the grain.” Is God concerned about oxen?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or does He say it completely for our sake? For our sake, no doubt, this is written so that he who plows should plow in hope, and that he who threshes in hope should partake of his hope.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If we have sown for you spiritual things, is it a great thing if we shall reap your material things?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If others partake of this right over you, should not we instead?
Nevertheless, we have not used this right, but suffer all things, lest we might hinder the gospel of Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do you not know that those who minister unto holy things live from the things of the temple? And do you not know that those who wait at the altar partake of the altar?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the same way, the Lord has ordained that those who preach the gospel should live from the gospel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I have used none of these rights, nor have I written these things that it should be so done to me. For it would be better for me to die than allow anyone to make my boasting void.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Though I preach the gospel, I have nothing to boast of, for the requirement is laid upon me. Yes, woe unto me if I do not preach the gospel!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So if I do this willingly, I have a reward, but if against my will, I have been entrusted with a commission.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What is my reward then? Truly that when I preach the gospel, I may present the gospel of Christ without charge, so that I may not abuse my authority in the gospel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For though I am free from all men, I have made myself servant to all, that I might win even more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To the Jews, I became as a Jew, that I might win the Jews; to those who are under the law, as under the law, that I might win those who are under the law;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to those who are outside the law, as outside the law (being not without God’s law, but under Christ’s law) that I might win those who are outside the law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To the weak, I became as weak, that I might win the weak. I have become all things to all men, that I might by all means save some.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This I do for the gospel’s sake, that I might partake of it with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do you not know that all those who run in a race run, but one receives the prize? So run, that you may obtain it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everyone who strives for the prize exercises self-control in all things. Now they do it to obtain a corruptible crown, but we an incorruptible one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So, therefore, I run, not with uncertainty. So I fight, not as one who beats the air.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I bring and keep my body under subjection, lest when preaching to others I myself should be disqualified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I would not want you to be unaware that all our fathers were under the cloud, and all passed through the sea,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all were baptized into Moses in the cloud and in the sea;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: all ate the same spiritual food;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all drank the same spiritual drink, for they drank of that spiritual Rock that followed them, and that Rock was Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But with many of them God was not well pleased, and they were overthrown in the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now these things were our examples to the intent that we should not lust after evil things as they lusted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Neither be idolaters as were some of them. As it is written, “The people sat down to eat and drink and rose up to revel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Neither let us commit sexual immorality as some of them committed, when twenty-three thousand fell in one day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Neither let us tempt Christ, as some of them also tempted and were destroyed by serpents.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Neither murmur, as some of them also murmured and were destroyed by the destroyer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now all these things happened to them for examples. They are written as an admonition to us, upon whom the end of the ages has come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore let him who thinks he stands take heed, lest he fall.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No temptation has taken you except what is common to man. God is faithful, and He will not permit you to be tempted above what you can endure, but will with the temptation also make a way to escape, that you may be able to bear it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So, my beloved, flee from idolatry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I speak as to wise men. Judge for yourselves what I say.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The cup of blessing which we bless, is it not the communion of the blood of Christ? The bread which we break, is it not the communion of the body of Christ?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we, being many, are one bread and one body, for we are all partakers of that one bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Consider Israel after the flesh: Are not those who eat of the sacrifices partakers of the altar?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What am I saying then, that the idol is anything or that which is offered in sacrifice to idols is anything?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I say that the things which the Gentiles sacrifice, they sacrifice to demons, and not to God. I do not want you to have fellowship with demons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You cannot drink the cup of the Lord and the cup of demons. You cannot be partakers of the Lord’s table and of the table of demons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do we provoke the Lord to jealousy? Are we stronger than He?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “All things are lawful for me,” but not all things are helpful. “All things are lawful for me,” but not all things edify.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let no one seek his own, but each one the other’s well-being.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Eat whatever is sold in the meat market, asking no question for the sake of conscience,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for “The earth is the Lord’s, and everything in it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If any of those who do not believe invite you to a feast, and you desire to go, eat whatever is set before you, asking no question for the sake of conscience.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if anyone says to you, “This was offered in sacrifice to idols,” do not eat it for the sake of him that mentioned it and for the sake of conscience, for “The earth is the Lord’s, and everything in it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Conscience, I say, not your own, but that of the other. For why is my liberty judged by another man’s conscience?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I partake with thankfulness, why am I slandered concerning that for which I give thanks?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, whether you eat, or drink, or whatever you do, do it all to the glory of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Give no offense, neither to the Jews, nor to the Gentiles, nor to the church of God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: just as I try to please all men in all things, not seeking my own profit, but the profit of many, that they may be saved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Follow me as I follow Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I praise you, brothers, that you remember me in all things and keep the traditions as I delivered them to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I would have you know that the head of the woman is the man, the head of every man is Christ, and the head of Christ is God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every man praying or prophesying having his head covered dishonors his head,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but every woman who prays or prophesies with her head uncovered dishonors her head, for that is the same as if she were shaved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if the woman is not covered, let her also cut off her hair. But if it is a shame for a woman to have her hair cut off or shaved, let her be covered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For a man indeed ought not to cover his head, because he is the image and glory of God. But the woman is the glory of the man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The man is not from the woman, but the woman from the man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The man was not created for the woman, but the woman for the man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this reason the woman ought to have a veil of authority over her head, because of the angels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless, neither is the man without the woman, nor the woman without the man in the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For just as the woman came from the man, so the man comes through the woman, but all things come from God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Judge for yourselves. Is it proper for a woman to pray to God uncovered?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Does even nature itself not teach you that if a man has long hair it is a shame to him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if a woman has long hair, it is a glory to her, for her hair is given her for a covering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if anyone seems to be contentious, we have no such custom, nor have the churches of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now in what I have to say to you, I do not praise you. You have come together not for the better, but for the worse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: First of all, when you come together as the church, I hear that there are divisions among you, and in part I believe it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For there must also be factions among you so that those who are genuine may become evident among you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore when you come together into one place, it is not to eat the Lord’s Supper.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For in eating, each one eats his own supper ahead of others. One goes hungry, and another becomes drunk.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What? Do you not have houses to eat and to drink in? Or do you despise the church of God and shame those who have nothing? What shall I say to you? Shall I praise you in this? I do not praise you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have received of the Lord that which I delivered to you: that the Lord Jesus, on the night in which He was betrayed, took bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When He had given thanks, He broke it and said, “Take and eat. This is My body which is broken for you. Do this in remembrance of Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the same manner He took the cup after He had supper, saying, “This cup is the new covenant in My blood. Do this, as often as you drink it, in remembrance of Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As often as you eat this bread and drink this cup, you proclaim the Lord’s death until He comes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore whoever eats this bread and drinks this cup of the Lord unworthily will be guilty of the body and blood of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let a man examine himself, and so eat of the bread and drink of the cup.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he who eats and drinks unworthily, eats and drinks damnation to himself, not discerning the Lord’s body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this reason many are weak and unhealthy among you, and many die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If we would judge ourselves, we would not be judged.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when we are judged, we are disciplined by the Lord, so that we would not be condemned with the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So, my brothers, when you come together to eat, wait for one another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If anyone hungers, let him eat at home, so that you may not come together into condemnation.
I will set the rest in order when I come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now concerning spiritual gifts, brothers, I do not want you to be ignorant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You know that you were Gentiles, carried away to these dumb idols, however you were led.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore I make known to you that no one speaking by the Spirit of God says, “Jesus be cursed!” And no one can say, “Jesus is the Lord,” except by the Holy Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There are various gifts, but the same Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There are differences of administrations, but the same Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There are various operations, but it is the same God who operates all of them in all people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the manifestation of the Spirit is given to everyone for the common good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To one is given by the Spirit the word of wisdom, to another the word of knowledge by the same Spirit,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to another faith by the same Spirit, to another gifts of healings by the same Spirit,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to another the working of miracles, to another prophecy, to another discerning of spirits, to another various kinds of tongues, and to another the interpretation of tongues.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But that one and very same Spirit works all these, dividing to each one individually as He will.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For as the body is one and has many parts, and all the many parts of that one body are one body, so also is Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For by one Spirit we are all baptized into one body, whether we are Jews or Gentiles, whether we are slaves or free, and we have all been made to drink of one Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The body is not one part, but many.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the foot says, “Because I am not the hand, I am not of the body,” is it therefore not of the body?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if the ear says, “Because I am not the eye, I am not of the body,” is it therefore not of the body?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the whole body were an eye, where would the hearing be? If the whole body were hearing, where would the sense of smell be?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now God has established the parts, every one of them, in the body as it has pleased Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If they were all one part, where would the body be?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So there are many parts, yet one body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The eye cannot say to the hand, “I have no need of you,” nor the head to the feet, “I have no need of you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No, those parts of the body which seem to be weaker are necessary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And those parts of the body which we think are less honorable, upon these we bestow more abundant honor. And our less respectable parts are treated with much more respect,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: whereas our more respectable parts have no need of this. But God has composed the body, having given more abundant honor to that part which lacks it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that there should be no division in the body, but that the parts should have the same care for one another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If one part suffers, all the parts suffer with it, and if one part is honored, all the parts rejoice with it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now you are the body of Christ and members individually.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God has put these in the church: first apostles, second prophets, third teachers, after that miracles, then gifts of healings, helps, governments, and various tongues.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Are all apostles? Are all prophets? Are all teachers? Are all workers of miracles?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do all have the gifts of healings? Do all speak with tongues? Do all interpret?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But earnestly covet the greater gifts.
Yet I show you a more excellent way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I speak with the tongues of men and of angels, and have not love, I have become as sounding brass or a clanging cymbal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I have the gift of prophecy, and understand all mysteries and all knowledge, and if I have all faith, so that I could remove mountains, and have not love, I am nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I give all my goods to feed the poor, and if I give my body to be burned, and have not love, it profits me nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Love suffers long and is kind; love envies not; love flaunts not itself and is not puffed up,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: does not behave itself improperly, seeks not its own, is not easily provoked, thinks no evil;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: rejoices not in iniquity, but rejoices in the truth;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: bears all things, believes all things, hopes all things, and endures all things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Love never fails. But if there are prophecies, they shall fail; if there are tongues, they shall cease; and if there is knowledge, it shall vanish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we know in part, and we prophesy in part.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when that which is perfect comes, then that which is imperfect shall pass away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When I was a child, I spoke as a child, I understood as a child, and I thought as a child. But when I became a man, I put away childish things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For now we see as through a glass, dimly, but then, face to face. Now I know in part, but then I shall know, even as I also am known.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So now abide faith, hope, and love, these three. But the greatest of these is love.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Follow after love and desire spiritual gifts, but especially that you may prophesy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he who speaks in an unknown tongue does not speak to men, but to God. For no one understands him, although in the spirit, he speaks mysteries.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he who prophesies speaks to men for their edification and exhortation and comfort.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He who speaks in an unknown tongue edifies himself, but he who prophesies edifies the church.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I desire that you all speak in tongues, but even more that you prophesy. For greater is he who prophesies than he who speaks in tongues, unless he interprets, so that the church may receive edification.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now, brothers, if I come to you speaking in tongues, what shall I profit you, unless I speak to you by revelation or knowledge or prophesying or doctrine?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even when things without life give sound, whether flute or harp, how will it be known what is played unless they give a distinction in the sounds?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the trumpet makes an uncertain sound, who will prepare himself for the battle?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So also you, unless with the tongue you speak words easy to understand, how will it be known what is spoken? For you shall speak into the air.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There are, it may be, so many kinds of languages in the world, and none of them is without significance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, if I do not know the meaning of the speech, I shall be a barbarian to him who speaks, and he who speaks will be a barbarian to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So, seeing that you are zealous of spiritual gifts, seek that you may excel to the edifying of the church.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let him who speaks in an unknown tongue pray that he may interpret.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if I pray in an unknown tongue, my spirit prays, but my understanding is unfruitful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What is it then? I will pray with the spirit, and I will pray with the understanding. I will sing with the spirit, and I will sing with the understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Otherwise, when you bless with the spirit, how will he who occupies the place of the unlearned say “Amen” at your giving of thanks, seeing he does not understand what you say?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you indeed give thanks well, but the other is not edified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I thank my God that I speak in tongues more than you all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet in the church I had rather speak five words with my understanding, that by my voice I might teach others also, than ten thousand words in an unknown tongue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Brothers, do not be children in your thinking; rather be infants in evil, but in your thinking be mature.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the law it is written:
“With men of other tongues
    and other lips
I will speak to this people;
    but even then they will not hear Me,”
        says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So tongues are for a sign, not to believers, but to unbelievers. But prophesying does not serve unbelievers, but believers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore if the whole church assembles in one place and all speak with tongues, and those who are unlearned or unbelievers come in, will they not say that you are out of your mind?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if all prophesy and there comes in one who does not believe or one unlearned, he is convinced by all and judged by all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus the secrets of his heart are revealed. And so falling down on his face, he will worship God and report that God is truly among you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How is it then, brothers? When you come together, every one of you has a psalm, a teaching, a tongue, a revelation, and an interpretation. Let all things be done for edification.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone speaks in an unknown tongue, let it be by two, or at the most by three, and each in turn, and let one interpret.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if there is no interpreter, let him remain silent in the church, and let him speak to himself and to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let two or three prophets speak, and let the others judge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anything is revealed to another that sits by, let the first keep silent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you may all prophesy one by one, that all may learn and all may be encouraged.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The spirits of the prophets are subject to the prophets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For God is not the author of confusion, but of peace, as in all churches of the saints.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let your women remain silent in the churches. For they are not permitted to speak. They are commanded to be under obedience, as the law also says.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If they will learn anything, let them ask their husbands at home, for it is a shame for women to speak in the church.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What? Did the word of God come from you? Or did it come to you only?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone thinks himself to be a prophet or spiritual, let him acknowledge that what I am writing you is a command of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if anyone is ignorant, let him be ignorant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, brothers, eagerly desire to prophesy, and do not forbid speaking in tongues.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let all things be done decently and in order.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now, brothers, I declare to you the gospel which I preached to you, which you have received, and in which you stand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Through it you are saved, if you keep in memory what I preached to you, unless you have believed in vain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I delivered to you first of all that which I also received: how Christ died for our sins according to the Scriptures,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: was buried, rose again the third day according to the Scriptures,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and was seen by Cephas, and then by the twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He was seen by over five hundred brothers at once, of whom the greater part remain to this present time, though some have passed away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He was seen by James and then by all the apostles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Last of all, He was seen by me also, as by one born at the wrong time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I am the least of the apostles and am not fit to be called an apostle, because I persecuted the church of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But by the grace of God I am what I am. And His grace toward me was not in vain. I labored more abundantly than all of them, yet not I, but the grace of God which was with me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, whether it was I or they, so we preach and so you believed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now if Christ is preached that He rose from the dead, how can some of you say that there is no resurrection of the dead?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If there is no resurrection of the dead, then Christ has not risen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If Christ has not risen, then our preaching is vain, and your faith is also vain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yes, and we would then be found false witnesses of God, because we have testified that God raised up Christ, whom He did not raise up, if in fact the dead do not rise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if the dead do not rise, then Christ has not been raised.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If Christ is not raised, your faith is vain; you are still in your sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they also who have fallen asleep in Christ have perished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If in this life only we have hope in Christ, we are of all men most miserable.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now is Christ risen from the dead and become the first fruits of those who have fallen asleep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For since death came by man, by man came also the resurrection of the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For as in Adam all die, even so in Christ shall all be made alive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But every man in his own order: Christ the first fruits; afterward, those who are Christ’s at His coming.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then comes the end when He will deliver up the kingdom to God the Father, when He puts an end to all rule and all authority and power.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For He will reign until He has put all enemies under His feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The last enemy that will be destroyed is death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For He “has put all things under His feet.” But when He says, “all things are put under Him,” it is revealed that He, who has put all things under Him, is the exception.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When all things are subjected to Him, then the Son Himself will also be subject to Him who put all things under Him, that God may be all in all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Otherwise, what will they do who are baptized for the dead, if the dead do not rise at all? Why are they then baptized for the dead?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And why do we stand in danger every hour?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I affirm, by the boasting in you which I have in Christ Jesus our Lord, I die daily.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If, in the manner of men, I have fought with beasts at Ephesus, what advantage is it to me if the dead do not rise?
“Let us eat and drink,
    for tomorrow we die.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not be deceived: “Bad company corrupts good morals.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Awake to righteousness and do not sin, for some do not have the knowledge of God. I say this to your shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But someone will say, “How are the dead raised up? With what body do they come?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You fool! What you sow is not made alive unless it dies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you sow, you do not sow the body that shall be, but a bare kernel, perhaps of wheat or of some other grain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then God gives it a body as He pleases, and to each seed its own body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All flesh is not the same flesh. There is one kind of flesh of men, another flesh of beasts, another of fish, and another of birds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There are also celestial bodies and terrestrial bodies. The glory of the celestial is one, and the glory of the terrestrial is another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is one glory of the sun, and another glory of the moon, and another glory of the stars. One star differs from another star in glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So also is the resurrection of the dead. The body is sown in corruption; it is raised in incorruption.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is sown in dishonor, it is raised in glory. It is sown in weakness, it is raised in power.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is sown a natural body, it is raised a spiritual body.
There is a natural body, and there is a spiritual body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So it is written, “The first man Adam was made a living soul.” The last Adam was made a life-giving spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, that which is spiritual is not first, but the natural, and then the spiritual.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The first man was of the earth, made of dust; the second man was the Lord from heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As was the man of dust, so are those who are of dust; and as is the man of heaven, so are those who are of heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As we have borne the image of the man of dust, we shall also bear the image of the man of heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now this I say, brothers, that flesh and blood cannot inherit the kingdom of God, nor does corruption inherit incorruption.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Listen, I tell you a mystery: We shall not all sleep, but we shall all be changed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In a moment, in the twinkling of an eye, at the last trumpet, for the trumpet will sound, the dead will be raised incorruptible, and we shall be changed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this corruptible will put on incorruption, and this mortal will put on immortality.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When this corruptible will have put on incorruption, and this mortal will have put on immortality, then the saying that is written shall come to pass: “Death is swallowed up in victory.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“O death, where is your sting?
    O grave, where is your victory?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sting of death is sin, and the strength of sin is the law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But thanks be to God, who gives us the victory through our Lord Jesus Christ!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, my beloved brothers, be steadfast, unmovable, always abounding in the work of the Lord, knowing that your labor in the Lord is not in vain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now concerning the collection for the saints, as I have given instruction to the churches of Galatia, so even you must do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the first day of the week let every one of you lay in store, as God has prospered him, so that no collections be made when I come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when I come, I will send whomever you approve with your letters to take your generous gifts to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If it is fitting that I go also, they will go with me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now I will come to you after I pass through Macedonia. For I will pass through Macedonia.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It may be that I will remain, of course, and spend the winter with you, that you may send me on my journey wherever I go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I do not wish to see you now in passing. Instead, I trust to remain a while with you, if the Lord permits.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I will remain at Ephesus until Pentecost.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For a great and effective door has opened to me, and there are many adversaries.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now if Timothy comes, see that he may remain with you without fear, for he does the work of the Lord, as I also do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore let no one despise him. But send him on his way in peace, that he may come to me. I am expecting him with the brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for our brother Apollos, I greatly wanted him to come to you with the brothers. But he was not willing at all to come at this time. However, he will come when he has a convenient time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Watch, stand fast in the faith, be bold like men, and be strong.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let all that you do be done with love.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You know the house of Stephanas, that it is the first fruits of Achaia, and that they have devoted themselves to the ministry of the saints. So I ask you, brothers,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that you submit yourselves to such people, and to everyone who helps and labors with us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am happy about the arrival of Stephanas, Fortunatus, and Achaicus, for they supplied what was lacking on your part.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They have refreshed my spirit and yours. Therefore acknowledge these men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The churches of Asia greet you. Aquila and Priscilla greet you heartily in the Lord, with the church that is in their house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the brothers greet you. Greet one another with a holy kiss.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I, Paul, write this greeting with my own hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone does not love the Lord Jesus Christ, let him be accursed. Come, O Lord!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My love be with you all in Christ Jesus. Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator
